context: "Arsti" is the genitive singular form of the Estonian word "arst", which means "doctor" or "physician". In Estonian grammar, the genitive case typically indicates possession or relationship, so "arsti" can mean "of a doctor," "to a doctor," or "from a doctor" depending on the context. It's commonly used when saying you're going to see a doctor, referring to something belonging to a doctor, or indicating movement toward/from a doctor.
